intro: Eriosemopsis subanisophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaf eriosemopsis, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces small, yellowish to orange flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sunlight, making it suitable for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its delicate foliage and subtle floral display.
